alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 8:03PM CST until February 17 at 9:00PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following county, Cherokee. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 803 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Centre, Cedar Bluff, Centre Municipal Airport, Forney, Little River Canyon National Preserve, Leesburg, Sand Rock, Gaylesville, Eastern Weiss Lake, Moshat, Cornwall Furnace Park, Western Weiss Lake, Tennala, Blanche, Ball Flat, Pleasant Gap, Cherokee Rock Village, Little River Falls, Slackland and Howells Crossroads.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
